i1.blurb: Taliyah gains movement speed near walls.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Taliyah''' gains up to {{pp|key=%|20 to 45|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, which builds up over 1 second if she had been near terrain or [[:Category:Structures|structures]] for at least {{fd|0.4}} seconds and decays by the {{tt|same amount|more in notes}} if out of [[range]] for at least {{fd|0.8}} seconds.
Entering combat or casting an ability puts ''Rock Surfing'' on a 2 second {{sti|cooldown}} that is continuously refreshed while remaining in combat.
i1.name: Rock Surfing
notes: * '''Taliyah's''' basic attack disables ''Rock Surfing'' on-hit. If the target dies before the projectile connects, ''Rock Surfing'' will not go on cooldown.
* The build up and decay changes by the same amount in the same interval, which is 25% of the maximum value every {{fd|0.25}} seconds.

q1.blurb: Taliyah throws a volley of missiles in a target direction, moving freely as she does. This works the ground below her. If Taliyah casts Threaded Volley on worked ground, she only throws one missile.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} After {{fd|0.25}} seconds, '''Taliyah''' unleashes 5 ''Stone Shards'' in quick succession in the target direction over {{fd|1.5}} seconds, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to the first target hit. Units hit by multiple ''Stone Shards'' take 50% damage beyond the first.
'''Taliyah''' can move and cast other abilities while launching ''Stone Shards''. After launching the third ''Stone Shard'' she's also able to basic attack.

Casting ''Threaded Volley'' creates an area of ''Worked Ground'' 450 units radius wide around '''Taliyah''' that lasts {{tt|45|Not affected by cooldown reduction}} seconds. While on ''Worked Ground'', '''Taliyah''' only hurls one ''Stone Shard'' upon casting ''Threaded Volley'' and reduces its {{sti|mana|{{as|mana cost to 1}}}}.
leveling: {{st|Minimum Magic Damage|{{ap|70 to 170}} {{as|(+ 45% AP)}}|Maximum Single-Target Damage|{{ap|70*3 to 170*3}} {{as|(+ 135% AP)}}|Maximum Damage|{{ap|70*5 to 170*5}} {{as|(+ 225% AP)}}}}
q1.name: Threaded Volley
notes: * The first ''Stone Shard'' hit on each target is considered {{tip|single target}} damage and triggers effects such as {{nie|Shock}} from {{ii|Muramana}}, while additional ones of the same cast are considered {{tip|dot|damage-over-time}}.

* The first ''Stone Shard'' is launched instantly after the cast time. After {{fd|0.5}} seconds is then launched the second and after the same delay is then launched the third. After another {{fd|0.25}} seconds is launched the fourth and after the same delay is then launched the fifth.
* '''Taliyah's''' position on ''Worked Ground'' updates every {{fd|0.15}} seconds. This does not effect the amount of stones she launches but it may affect the mana reduction.
** If '''Taliyah''' leaves the ''Worked Ground'' and casts ''Threaded Volley'' before her position updates, she will launch 5 ''Stone Shards'' at 1 mana cost.
** If '''Taliyah''' instead enters the ''Worked Ground'', she will launch 1 ''Stone Shard'' at full mana cost.

w1.blurb: Taliyah causes an area of ground to erupt and throws enemies within in a direction of her choosing.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} After {{fd|0.25}} seconds, '''Taliyah''' marks the target location and selects a direction. After 1 second, the ground erupts, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies hit and {{tip|airborne|knocking}} them in the chosen direction for 1 second.
w1.name: Seismic Shove
notes: * ''Seismic Shove'' can knock targets over walls.

e1.blurb: Taliyah creates a slowing minefield that explodes if enemies dash through it or are pushed/pulled through it.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} After {{fd|0.25}} seconds, '''Taliyah''' scatters 18 boulders over the ground in a cone before her, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies hit.

The boulders then remain for 4 seconds, {{tip|slow|slowing}} all enemies within the area by 20% {{as|(+ 4% per 100 AP)}}. At the end of their duration, all remaining boulders explode, dealing ''Unraveled Earth's'' initial damage once more.

Enemies who {{tip|dash}} over or are {{tip|airborne|knocked through}} the boulders will detonate them instantly, each dealing {{as|magic damage}}. Enemies can detonate multiple boulders, but they will only take damage from a maximum of 4, reduced by {{pp|4|changedisplay=true|key=%|type=boulder hit|0 to 45}}.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|50 to 150}} {{as|(+ 40% AP)}}|Total Magic Damage|{{ap|50*2 to 150*2}} {{as|(+ 80% AP)}}}}
{{st|Minimum Trigger Damage|{{ap|50 to 90}} {{as|(+ 30% AP)}}|Maximum Trigger Damage|{{ap|50*(1+0.85+0.7+0.55) to 90*(1+0.85+0.7+0.55)}} {{as|(+ 93% AP)}}}}
e1.name: Unraveled Earth
notes: * Triggering a boulder deals damage only to the enemy that detonated it.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will block one instance of damage.

r1.blurb: Stone Weaver creates a very long wall and then surfs it.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Taliyah''' {{ct|channel|channels|attack=false|move=false|cast=false|consume=Disabled, but can activate trinkets|items=false|spells=false,false,false,interrupts,false}} for 1 second before summoning a massive wall of spiraling rock that tears through the battlefield in the target direction, creating impassable terrain for 5 seconds and {{tip|airborne|knocking aside}} allied and enemy champions it passes through as it emerges.

'''Taliyah''' can reactivate ''Weaver's Wall'' while channeling to {{tip|dash|ride}} atop the wall at 1500 speed as it emerges. Taking damage during or after the cast time will force her off the wall, which will continue along its path normally. After {{fd|0.75}} seconds she can input a movement command to manually jump off the wall.
''Weaver's Wall'' can be reactivated after it reaches its {{tt|maximum range|after 1.75 seconds}} to destroy it instantly.
r1.name: Weaver's Wall
notes: * The {{tip|airborne|knockup}} on allied champions can be used by an enemy {{ci|Yasuo}} to trigger {{ai|Last Breath|Yasuo}}.
* If ''Weaver's Wall'' is allowed to expire normally, the wall collapses with the same progression as it was formed.
* She's more likely to jump off to the left side of ''Weaver's Wall''.
